Plugins - Notation

Plugins in this category add valid notation to commands.

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_notation.NotationConstants(table=None)

Calculator plugin to expand _x to constants['x'], where the dictionary contains common physical constants

Calculator >>> _c # Speed of light
299792458
Calculator >>> _g # Earth's gravity
9.80665000000000
Calculator >>> _Na # Avogadro's constant
6.02214076000000e-23

Initializes the plugin with the lookup table

Parameters

table (dict[str, Any]) – The lookup table to use. Defaults to physical constants

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_notation.NotationExponent

Calculator plugin to change ^ to **, the Python syntax for powers

Calculator >>> /ne
Calculator >>> 3^3
27

Note

This is a implemented as a simple string substitution, and will not differentiate between notation and the contents of a string. For this reason, this plugin is opt-in with the /ne toggle

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_notation.NotationInterval

Calculator plugin to allow for shortened interval notation

Calculator >>> i[0,oo[
[0, ∞)
Result stored in out[6]
Calculator >>> i[-3,3]
[-3, 3]

Note

The current implementation may collide with subscripting variables that end in i and produce unwanted behavior. Use the toggle /ni to opt-out

Note

This plugin only understands the french notation for open intervals. eg. i]-oo,oo[

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_notation.NotationMultiply

Calculator plugin to allow for multiplication by juxtaposition

Calculator >>> 2pi
2⋅π
Calculator >>> 2b(x+3)**2
   2        2
2⋅b ⋅(x + 3)
Calculator >>> 2 a b sin(x)cos(x)
2⋅a⋅b⋅sin(x)⋅cos(x)
Calculator >>> 2ab
2⋅a⋅b

Note

Be careful with juxtaposing with variable denominators. It may produce unexpected parsing due to Python’s call precedence

Calculator >>> 2x/y(x+1)
   2⋅x
─────────
y⋅(x + 1)

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others

class symcalc.plugins.plugins_notation.NotationVector

Calculator plugin to allow for shortened vector and matrix notation

Calculator >>> v[1,2,3]
⎡1⎤
⎢ ⎥
⎢2⎥
⎢ ⎥
⎣3⎦
Calculator >>> m[1,2,3\4,5,6]
⎡1  2  3⎤
⎢       ⎥
⎣4  5  6⎦

Note

The current implementation may collide with subscripting variables that end in v and produce unwanted behavior. Use the toggle /ni to opt-out

Initializes the plugin

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the plugin

  • priority (int) – The priority of the plugin. Lower numbers designate that a plugin should be run before others
